intro: Valerianella affinis, commonly known as mouse whiskers, is a flowering plant in the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae). It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble the whiskers of a mouse, giving it its common name. Valerianella affinis is often found in disturbed soils and is cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
